go_data.justification: ubiquitin interacts with various proteins, including ubiquitin conjugating enzymes like Ubc7p, as part of the ubiquitin-proteasome system.
ubiquitin is a key component of the ubiquitin-proteasome system, which is involved in degrading misfolded proteins and maintaining protein quality.
ubiquitin is involved in the endoplasmic reticulum-associated degradation (ERAD) pathway, which takes place in the endoplasmic reticulum.
ubiquitin is a central component of the ubiquitin-proteasome system, which is responsible for degrading proteins marked by ubiquitination.
